XxLostNeoxX

What do casting tickets do?
On september 26, 2013
Meadow

Q2: What do casting tickets do? Asked by: XxLostNeoxX
A2: Casting tickets do nothing at the current moment. However when the Casting Beta is enabled you can make a group just like any MT group, but this one will be for Mush.

In it you can spend the Casting tickets for several purposes:

Initial Start/Upgrading the Casting, this enables you to invite more players and receiving more benefits.
I am Ready - This action requires 1 ticket.

Additional info: You require atleast several members and tickets initially for your group or face disbandment, atleast 32 players are required to be ready after the initial phase (does not need to be immediate) for two random ships from your casting to be started.

I believe though that Casting ships will not count toward rankings (?)

You can earn Blue tickets and up to two only at any time. However you can hold any amount of Golden tickets. The latter can be gotten from the Gold Mode subscription, and more can be bought at the vending machine when they're available.

Q3: If that ship that enables you to collect scrap is missing, it is probably likely that someone took it out and jumped out of it via space suit, right? So the actual question is...can you get it back?
On september 27, 2013
[6826491]
ZanarkandQ3: If that ship that enables you to collect scrap is missing, it is probably likely that someone took it out and jumped out of it via space suit, right? So the actual question is...can you get it back?

A3: Short answer: No. I'm assuming that you've already moved the ship to a new location, and that the person who took it out was one of your mush (a very clever, albeit suicidal tactic, indeed.)

One of the projects will bring any of your patrol ships with you if the ship moves, and I'm assuming the Pasiphae is included in that...but the pilot onboard still has to manually land the ship. Even if you have this project finished, the ship is lost to you unless the pilot lands it.

Q10: Nexus offers 3 good projects. Once we complete 1, are 2 other lost forever, or are that available with Neron updates from the Bridge? If not, will the first 3 completed updates from the bridge be exactly those 3 projects?

Q11: This might be a bit complicated, but can someone give me a summary of what each character essentially has to do in a ship?
On september 28, 2013
[6826491]
PringlesXDQ11: This might be a bit complicated, but can someone give me a summary of what each character essentially has to do in a ship?

A11: Short of writing a guide myself, you might want to start reading here. Not all of the skills are detailed, and much is left out, but it's a good start.

I don't intend to sound dismissive with this statement, so please don't take it as such: Learn as much as you can by playing the game. Ask lots of questions, learn about what other characters can do, but most of all, don't be afraid to make mistakes. Sometimes those mistakes can cause you to get killed, but you will (hopefully) be wiser for that experience. Read the afterparty threads, too. There is a lot of really useful information to glean from those threads! (I'm serious; it's even easier to learn from the mistakes others have made, than to have to learn from them the hard way.)

A11 As players may see and play differently from each other, I would say to each is own. But still, here's what I think.

  • Chao: 1st: (Mush) Killer, Investigation, 2nd: Expedition (steaks), Relay (either lab/nexus/pilgred) 3rd Turrets.
  • Chun: 1st: Lab relay (and some actions I cannot tell about), 2nd: Healer.
  • Eleesha: 1st: Investigation, 2nd: Relay (any).
  • Finola: 1st: Lab relay, 2nd: Healer, 3rd: Expeditions (diplomacy).
  • Frieda: 1st: Planet scans, 2nd: Hunters, 3rd: Expeditions.
  • Gioele: 1st: Cameras instalment, Relay (any), later on Coffee drinker, Planet Scans. 2nd: Killer, 3rd: Heavy items mover.
  • Hua: 1st: Hunters, Expeditions (fruits). 2nd: Gardening. 3rd: Tech and Nexus.
  • Ian: 1st: Gardening, Expeditions (fruits), Lab. 2nd: Healer.
  • Janice: 1st: Shrink, 2nd: Nexus relay, 3rd: Expeditions (diplomacy).
  • Jin Su: 1st: Leader, moving the ship. 2nd: Hunters. 3rd: Expeditions.
  • Kuan Ti: 1st: Nexus relay. 2nd Planet scans. 3rd: Tech.
  • Paola: 1st: Comm's, 2nd: Lab relay, 3rd: Turrets.
  • Raluca: 1st: Pilgred, 2nd: Nexus and Tech.
  • Roland: 1st: Hunters, 2nd: Relay (any).
  • Stephen: 1st: Cook, 2nd: Expeditions (fights).
  • Terrence: 1st: Drones, 2nd: Nexus/Tech, 3rd: Hunters.

On september 30, 2013
[7786937]

What does "relay" mean? What do you exactly do?
And what Glory is for? Are there any actual benefits? Why people care about it?
On september 30, 2013
[6826491]
Mortymer_Vegas[Q17]What does "relay" mean? What do you exactly do?
And what Glory is for? Are there any actual benefits? Why people care about it?

A17: To "relay" is to alternate participation on projects and research, since one's efficiency drops with successive attempts. So rather than use my AP three times in a row, I use it once, then a second person does it, and then I do so again, and so on. It's MUCH more efficient that way.

Glory is for the rankings, which may put you on the leaderboards. It's not 100% representative of how good you are at the game, but generally speaking, the more communicative/team-oriented players will be higher up on the leaderboards. Gameplay-wise, it doesn't mean much, except for bragging rights.

[2767757]

How do you do it with someone?

On september 30, 2013
[6826491]

Q20a:
PringlesXD
How do you do it with someone?
A20a:
1. Be alone in a room with the other person, and with no camera present. Make sure there's an empty bed or Sofa. In other words, you both must be standing up. MedBay, or a room with just a sofa, are good choices for this. Dorms are not so optimal, because there's usually a camera.

2. Flirt, and the other player has to flirt back. (Note, some options are unavailable. Raluca can be flirted with, but can't flirt back, and Paola and her father Gioele are never going to flirt with each other. Obviously.)

3. Finally: Do the Thing. Yes, that is what it's called. As Incredible noted, there is a chance you may get spored, if the other person is mush.

jubjic

Q23: Let's say a human got infected by a third spore (or 4th, if there's certain research). Is conversion immediate? Will it be reflected at once in the total tab (X crew members, Y are mush, etc)?
On october 2, 2013
[6826491]

Q23
jubjic
Let's say a human got infected by a third spore (or 4th, if there's certain research). Is conversion immediate? Will it be reflected at once in the total tab (X crew members, Y are mush, etc)?
A23 Yes. And yes, but...it won't be reflected on the crew bar for everyone else unless they load or refresh the page. So there -might- be time for a newly turned person to take Anonymous, and not get noticed by the human players. But if the crew is very active, the new mush might get spotted.

Note: curing a mush back to human will work the same way; the page has to be reloaded for the crew bar to update.

[6330846]

Q26: Always was interesting, what actualy DIY Surgery(it's possible do in medlab) do?
On october 2, 2013
[6826491]
NavedanQ26: Always was interesting, what actualy DIY Surgery(it's possible do in medlab) do?

A26: First and foremost, it's a way to heal yourself if the medkit is lost or has been hidden. It costs 4 AP, instead of the normal 3 AP to self-heal with the medkit. Note that surgery is best used for healing wounds, while the medkit treats physical ailments, such as diseases. If Finola is alive to perform the surgery, she should do perform the surgery; it's her job, after all...
On october 2, 2013
Annette

On october 2, 2013
[6826491]

You're welcome! A side note I neglected to mention regarding healing: If someone is standing in the MedLab, then anyone can perform a healing action on them, or they can self-heal, without needing the Medkit in hand. They still have to be lying down for surgery, though.

On the 15 day ship, we ended up keeping the Medkit in Bravo Bay, so those in the aft of the ship could quickly heal both each other and the expo teams. Those in the front half of the ship just went to the Medlab as needed. It was a fairly efficient triage setup. Nobody had any wounds inflicted, so we never needed surgery, thankfully.

[6826491]
Kraxonwhat's important is that they can't pick it up back and alone i will get all the damage possible

That's potentially true. But on your own, you can only explore two sectors in a single expo. If neither of those sectors is hostile enough to kill you, you'll return to the ship after those two sectors are explored, and you'll probably be killed when you return. It's a risky gamble, and one best used on a crew of newbies, who don't know how dangerous certain sectors can be.

Q29: I saw at the status page there is a status named Gagged. what is it?
On october 3, 2013
[6826491]
natanh0Q29: I saw at the status page there is a status named Gagged. what is it?

A29: The duct tape can be used to forcibly cover the mouth of someone, so they can't speak. This prevents them from using the Walkie, and if they're suspected of being a Mush, they quite literally won't be able to speak in their own defense. I don't advise using it, personally. They are still be able to use post it notes to communicate, though.

[1887923]

Q38 Are alien steaks cookable and if so how do I cook them? The only option I saw with them at the kitchen was hyperfreeze. And they way they are right now makes them kinda dangerous to eat after too long.
On october 5, 2013
[6826491]
LalasaQ38 Are alien steaks cookable and if so how do I cook them? The only option I saw with them at the kitchen was hyperfreeze. And they way they are right now makes them kinda dangerous to eat after too long.

A38: Freezing steaks turns them into standard rations, which you of course can cook as normal. However, when you cook them matters. they maintain whatever state they were in before the freezing...which can mean they can give negative effects if they were frozen in a dubious/spoiled state. You can eat them this way, but you'll probably pay for it later.

Side note: Fruit and coffee can also be frozen, but to defrost them requires using the microwave, and this is bad for obvious reasons. Just like with steaks, the state of the fruit's freshness is maintained. Also, Consuming frozen fruit or coffee will make you lose morale...but at least it'll keep you from starving to death!
On october 5, 2013
[1887923]

Scout

Q69: I think I read it here but I'm not sure! The Surgery Pod, it's only used when the Medkit is gone right? Gone as in lost on expo? And, if so, does that include hidden on a shelf by a Mush (or anyone really but that would be playing against your team!)

A69: Surgery is only required for healing wounds (lost tongue, for example.) You can heal anyone's HP in the Medlab, as long as they're in the room - they don't have to be lying down on the bed. It works the same way as if you had the Medkit in hand; just click on the person you want to heal. You can also heal yourself in the medlab, at a cost of 3 AP per healing action instead of two. It's always more efficient if someone else does the healing!

NERON project: regenerates another coffee in cycle 4

PerpetualSinQ96 : Her lethargy skill, gives a bonus ap for 4 cycles in bed. So with this skill, assuming all day spent in bed she gets an extra 2ap?

A96: The first four cycles she spends in bed, she gets 2 per cycle, as others have explained. Now, as long as she continues the chain and gets back into a bed by the end of every cycle, she then gets 3 AP per cycle after that, and her AP maximum is doubled. I have personally confirmed that she can get up, eat, and accomplish tasks at any point during this chain, as long as she returns to a bed at the end of every cycle. Other than the doubled AP maximum, there is no limit to how long she can continue to gain the extra AP...provided the chain is never broken.

I had a chain going for several days in a row on my last ship, until we had bad timing launching an expo, and I missed getting to a bed by literally ten minutes. If we'd launched just minutes sooner, that chain could have continued.

If she fails to get into a bed by the end of any cycle, the chain is considered broken, and she has to spend four consecutive cycles in bed before she starts getting 3 AP again. This makes Lethargy terribly difficult to use (since it stymies research) in the early game, and yet amazing for the late game, once Chun is free to leave the Lab.

spacekadt
nanomedNeed clarification on Q/A124. If there is a planet with 2 initial scan slots. Lets say Oxygen and Forests. If you go to an expedition, will the team have Event Oxygen, Event Forest and the expedition will be over or does it have a chance to also have Event Mankarong, Event Mountains in addition to Oxy and Forests?

The key words are "2 initial scan slots". If the planet only has two zones, you will only visit two zones.

If the planet has 8 zones and you've only uncovered 2, you will visit all 8 zones without knowing what you're about to face.

ShirleyMansonq133 what does multi teamster mean?

A133 It means two (or more) accounts on the same ship, logging in from the same location. It can be completely innocent in nature (say, two players from the same family, or a couple living together). But the potential implication is that it could be one person, using multiple accounts to cheat.

[7882968]

Oh yeah, and how many shooter points can we accumulate maximum?
On november 2, 2013
[6826491]

Killing indiscriminately is discouraged, and may involve sanctions. Killing someone with reasons given, might not involve sanctions; the circumstances involved are very important here, and every situation is different. But suffice it to say, if Chao (or anyone who is human) starts killing people without any reasons given, much less any solid evidence, you can report that player. And yes, if you have to kill that player in order to stop them, do so...but make sure to report the incident.

As for your Shooter question: Four charges, and you get x2 charges per day at the cycle 1 changeover. Use them or lose them. (Note that for any skill that has those sorts of charges, you can store up to two days' worth of them, whether they are for free healing, tech points, shooter points, etc.)

[6826491]

A139: Quarantines kill the player on their current ship, if they are in a game, as you've seen. But reports don't get looked at until after the game is over (however it may have ended). So whatever else they may have done to deserve the quarantine, it was done on a previous ship, or ships. So yes, this may screw over people on their next ship...but at least you won't have to deal with that player for a while.

ShirleyMansonQ: You can only print the Mush List from the tabulatrix once? Am I right? So it's better to print it on day 2 or day 3 rather than day 1? So the list will be more accurate?

On day 1, tabulatrix will show 8 names in which at least 1 is a Mush.
On day 2, it will show 7 and day 3, it shows 6 and so on. So printing it later is more accurate. But don't print it too late, timing is important in using the tabulatrix.

[6826491]
ShirleyMansonQ: You can only print the Mush List from the tabulatrix once? Am I right? So it's better to print it on day 2 or day 3 rather than day 1? So the list will be more accurate?

For every day that passes, one name will be removed from the list, once it's printed. Even still, Chun can also show up on the list, which can narrow it down by one more name. So it's a potentially good idea to wait a few days to print it.

spacekadt
popsicleman

Hello, I'm a new player who have a few questions about the game. Sorry if they are really silly or have already been answered somewhere (i tried to find answers to these on the forums w/ search. didn't work)

Q157: Somebody on my ship noted that they were unable to fire turret (this was before full crew). He claims to have had 4 aps, and there was not even a greyed out or crossed off option for using the turret; only examine was available as a choice. What is going on?

Is it possibly broken? Does he have a "report" or "repair" button? I've not seen or heard this before so I'm not really sure.

popsiclemanQ158: On a similar vein, my game's Hua successfully managed to pilot and shoot down a hunter but another player reported that he could get on the ship but not launch (with APs), receiving the message that the launch was blocked. (Weird because i thought it could only be done by the commander using the computer bios thing but we didn't have commander awake yet)

It's the Neron Administrator that can change those settings, but the ship's default is piloting lock so that only pilots can fly a patroller. If the player doesn't have the pilot skill, he won't be able to take off until the ship is full *and* Janice has changed the lock setting.

popsiclemanQ159: I'm seeing a lot of talk about multiple skills, gold, silver and experience. If we are not paying anything, do we get only the first basic skill or do we get to choose one from all the unlocked skill we used exp on?

On your first ship, you'll get the first skill automatically. Once you have 2 or more skills unlocked (or more skills than you have spaces for), you'll have a choice. If you start a ship as a new character that you haven't played before without leveling it up at least once (you can do that from the My Account page), you'll get that character's default choice as well.

You're also not limited to upgrading the character you're currently playing. You can use your current experience for any character from the My Account page. If you want to guarantee yourself choice, it might be worth putting the 5xp into each character as soon as you can... that way you have a little more flexibility.

[6826491]

A164: It's by intention, so cameras/fuel/O2 can't be hidden by mush or griefers. Now, at least for the fuel, you can go to either of the Rear Storage rooms, and inject the fuel into the fuel tank there. Or, you can take it to the engine room, and inject it into the Combustion Chamber there; do this next time you're in orbit of a planet, and the chamber is already empty. (You need one fuel to leave orbit, so that's the best time to do so.

As for the camera, ask where it needs to be installed, and hopefully your crew will tell you to put it in a critical room where it's needed...one of the dorms, or the Medlab, for example.

The_WallQ166 : (Sorry, hope i`m doing right this time ) And What coffee does, cuz i used one charge of the Thermos of Coffee and nothing happened

A166: Coffee gives 2 AP when consumed (4 if you are Gioele's level 3 skill ). The Thermos contains 4 Coffees which you can remove from it one by one. And then you have to consume the coffee.
On november 8, 2013
[6826491]
The_WallQ166 : (Sorry, hope i`m doing right this time ) And What coffee does, cuz i used one charge of the Thermos of Coffee and nothing happened

A166: It contains "charges" of coffee, just like you can get in the Refectory. Using one charge will put the coffee in your inventory, or drop in the room shelf if your inventory is full. Just be aware that if you're currently full (an apple icon on your portrait) you can't consume coffee. Also, coffee is like fruit, in that it will spoil if it's been around for too long. The Thermos won't spoil though...just the coffee item.

On november 9, 2013
[6826491]
AivarasQ172 Do fruits and coffee go bad? Cos they don't seam too...

A172: They definitely do, if food destruction is turned off, and more than 2 days pass. They're dubious, but safe on the second day since being created. On the third day, they will start to give a chance for the food poisoning illness. The chance increases the longer you wait to eat them. It's not so bad if you're Chun or Finola, and if you have free healing actions. But by that point in the voyage, someone else probably needs the help more.
On november 9, 2013
Aivaras

Q173 What can be done to make them safe? Use with Microwave? We have ship full of alien fruits...
On november 9, 2013
[6826491]
AivarasQ173 What can be done to make them safe? Use with Microwave? We have ship full of alien fruits...

A173: You can't cook them, so any negative effects are what you will get from them. But you can freeze them. What this will do is keep them from spoiling at the day change. Both coffee and fruits can be frozen this way. But there's a down side: Consuming frozen coffee/fruit will cost 1 AP and 1 morale, in addition to any possible negative effects.

To hyperdefrost them, so you can eat them normally, requires using the microwave and the Hyperdefrost action. You can't defrost them in the Refectory's kitchen, and the Cook action is not an option with them, either. Also note that spoiled food will stay spoiled if you freeze it, with the chances for an illness and all.

So, is it worth it? Probably not, from all the testing I've done. Keeping the microwave around is a huge risk, if there may be mush still alive. And even then, if you're relying on fruit for solving hunger or morale issues, then you will lose AP in the freezing/defrosting process (unless you're a Chef). And then there's the high probability that you'll eat the fruit well before it can begin to spoil...it just seems like a very suboptimal way to go. (And more often than not on my previous ships, the microwave was dismantled so we'd have scrap for the Sofa BP.

Q177 What are the effects of being dirty, and by extension the reasons for keeping clean?

Currently in my first ship and there doesn't seem to be any info about this in the Help topics, I got dirty fixing the reactor and it seemed to me if I was a mush I'd just stay dirty, as it's easily explained away.
On november 9, 2013
Aivaras

A177 When you dirty you cant do: research/scan for planets/work at nexus... Some characters do a lot of work with these so they should stay clean if possible. Also dirty might show you are mush as making spore make you dirty and mush get hurt when washing.
On november 9, 2013
[6826491]

A177: To add to what Aivaras wrote, mush get dirty when they extract spores. So many ships (I'd even say most, if experienced players are aboard) will have a "Dirty/Shower" thread, and everyone should favorite it. People list how and when they get dirty, whether it's through repairing, eating, cooking, working on Pilgred, fueling the engine, etc. The upshot is this: Anyone who gets dirty, but doesn't mention how or why, might be mush. People who don't report it immediately might be suspected of having something to hide...like sporing in an empty room.

It is to your benefit to keep track of being dirty, and reduce the chance your crewmates will suspect you of being Mush. Letting them know when you've showered helps too, because people who remain dirty for extended lengths of time are just as suspicious as those who get dirty but don't report it. Bad excuses, e.g. "I got dirty while working on Comms!" will probably get you killed; there are a lot of things that can make you dirty, including illnesses.

As you can probably guess, those who can corroborate the actions that make them dirty, tend to be under less suspicion than others. People who don't communicate this information - or fail to communicate it well - tend to get killed, more often than not.

Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

A194
NERON doesn't joke. Sometimes he's just mistaken when he announces the ship's moving towards a new planet when actually it's leaving the orbit, or when he announces broken equipments that in fact never break (PILGRED, beds, Icarus...).

That particular message means that the Daedalus collided with a hunter ship when the commander changed the heading. Sometimes it even kills the hunter.
On november 11, 2013
rumata
ktze

Q195 which are the steps to fuel the ship? i don't found the specific steps or from where i take the fuel and where i drop it.

Thanks.

A195:

  • There are two rooms in the back of the ship that open from Rear Corridor, called Rear Alpha Storage and Rear Bravo Storage.
  • Go there, click on the Fuel tank, then click Retrieve Fuel. (it is useful dropping your Tracker+Walkie if you have to move more than 1-2 Fuel).
  • Walk to the Engine Room next to it, and click on the Fuel in your inventory, then click Inject.
  • Click on Combustion Chamber, and check fuel level to make sure you have the correct amount loaded.
  • If more than 3 Fuel is needed, then go back to Rear Storage and repeat.

CptCookie

[Q192] "Activate: Advanced Mush" in My Settings

I already figured it allows you to acces the "Mutaion Page" ingame, but there's nothing to do in there. What's this about?

A192: You can pick your human skills there. If you have already picked all your Human skills, or turned on the Advanced Mush option after becoming Mush, then your Human skills already got selected for you.


WolowizardQ193: Is there some way to get oxygen(O2) besides discovering a planet that has it?

A193: You can go out in Pasiphae after shooting down some Hunters, and collect scraps. About half of the things you find will be capsules, and more than half of those will contain a single o2. If you want to make use of this, then you have to inject it to one of the o2 tanks in the Alpha/Bravo Central Storages.
On november 12, 2013
[6826491]
CptCookie

[Q192] "Activate: Advanced Mush" in My Settings

I already figured it allows you to acces the "Mutaion Page" ingame, but there's nothing to do in there. What's this about?

A192: If you're a Mush, you can still choose your human skills. That's the main reason it exists. If you were the last person to wake up, and a Mush, then you'd otherwise be unable to select your human skills.

WolowizardQ193: Is there some way to get oxygen(O2) besides discovering a planet that has it?

A193: When the Pasiphae goes out to collect scrap, it may sometimes find space capsules. When opened (for 1 AP) you may get one fuel or O2 per capsule. Just be aware that fuel/O2 are not able to be manually dropped onto a shelf. You will have to inject them into a tank, or the combustion chamber, in the case of fuel. When the ship needs to leave orbit, this is a good time to fuel it up (assuming you have one of these already in your inventory, and the chamber is empty).

The other way to get O2? Plants. Lots of well cared-for, mature plants. Alien fruits tend to mature in a day, sometimes even less.

On november 12, 2013
psibertus

Q192: what happens if I spend 10AP on "Guard" while in a room?
On november 12, 2013
[6826491]
psibertusQ194: what happens if I spend 10AP on "Guard" while in a room?

A194: Anyone who enters the room must exit through the same door they came in, and not through any other doors. They may do other things in the room, access items, engage in combat, etc. But the main purpose of the guard stance is to restrict movement. If you're human, going to guard is considered a hostile mush action (usually.) Mutated mush are permanently in a guard mode, too.

Also, Chun has the Sneak skill, which lets her bypass rooms under Guard, no matter how many hostiles are present. It's actually not very useful...

Otherwise, you should just be able to click on yourself for physical illnesses and injuries.

Spazticus

A194: Anyone who enters the room must exit through the same door they came in, and not through any other doors. They may do other things in the room, access items, engage in combat, etc. But the main purpose of the guard stance is to restrict movement. If you're human, going to guard is considered a hostile mush action (usually.) Mutated mush are permanently in a guard mode, too.

Also, Chun has the Sneak skill, which lets her bypass rooms under Guard, no matter how many hostiles are present. It's actually not very useful...

Enfilade

All expedition zones have percentile chances for different outcomes - one of the (unlikely) events in an oxygen zone is that no air is retrieved. Alternatively, if the planet had more zones than your team could explore at once, you might not have encountered the oxygen zone the first time. You would need to conduct a second mission in that case.

Q223

On november 15, 2013
[7899270]

A223 If you got the message as you first wake up from cryosleep, then you were likely the last person to join and got chosen as alpha mush. If you got it after a bit of playing, that means that you were being infected by the mush for some time. You aren't notified if you get spiked with a mush spore (and it takes 3 for you to be turned into mush). You can avoid turning into mush by avoiding ending your movements in rooms without cameras or mycoalarms. You can also help avoid turning into mush by removing the spores on you via supersoap or spore suckers.

On november 16, 2013
1412

Q232
So, while playing a mush, say I give myself away, really obviously. The entire ship knows. At this point am I allowed to just surrender?
On november 16, 2013
Enfilade

A229: Mush returning to Sol (or Eden) alive is a victory for them. You should get rid of them before finishing PILGRED.

A230: Gastroenteritis can be cured either with a corresponding pill (guaranteed) or with healing (chance). The injury you sustained from the blaster must be operated on in Medbay (not just healed).

A231: Anabolics give you +8MP.

A232: Surrender is not an option. If you've been found out, do as much damage as you can before they kill you. Hide stuff, gobble a pill, grab a weapon and start killing, steal the Pasiphae or Icarus, kill the cat, hack the command terminal. You technically win if the ship gets destroyed, even if you are killed, so do what you can to make it difficult for the humans to continue.

FragileQ234: Can sabotaging and breaking items start a fire? What ways are there to start a fire or increase the chances of fires? Obviously there's a mush skills for that along the way but that's pretty far away.

A234: No, and aside from the one Mush skill, it's all luck as far as fires are concerned. But if you don't fight them, they can spread in subsequent cycles. Thank you
Another question about Eleeshas third skill, does somebody know how this skill is working?
I asked several players but until now no one knew it for sure.
There was the theory that it works like a (25%) chance camera so she has got a chance of 25% to see a covert action when she is in the same room with the person that is doing that action (e. g. Eleesha is with a Mush in the same room the mush is infecting her and she has got a 25% chance of noticing it).
On november 16, 2013
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

It's a little complex, but basically :

- She has a 25 % chance of revealing a furtive action if she's in the room at the same time. The message "Eleesha has noticed something interesting" will appear in the room events and the furtive action will be visible for everyone, in red.

- For secret actions, the same message will appear when someone does or has done a secret action in the room (extracting a spore, eating, hiding an object...). The message can be simultaneous or can appear several cycles later, when Eleesha refreshes the page, when she does something, when she enters the room, or when someone else does something. It is usually (always ?) an action that was already visible in the room events because the action had been done in front of someone or before a camera.

For example : Terrence eats with Hua present in the room. The action is visible in red for everyone. Then Eleesha enters and the message "Eleesha has noticed something interesting" appears.

Some people say that Eleesha has a 25 % chance of revealing a Secret action that was done without witnesses. For example : Terrence is alone with no cameras, he extracts a spore. 2 cycles later, Eleesha enters the room and the action is revealed. I still have no proof that it's possible. I've never, ever seen it happen.
On november 16, 2013
Rain

We saw Eleesha notice something interesting on an early beta ship, and the only thing we could figure out, since no one had done anything lately other than level up, was someone getting a new skill. It's really weird, and I do wish the game described that skill better.

But from a functional standpoint as a mush, this skill basically means don't spore Eleesha directly if she has it, and don't spore someone in a room with her if she has it.

From a functional standpoint as Eleesha, look for something suspicious when you get this message, but be prepared to see that it's probably someone eating. Also, you might work a bit better as spore bait, as a last resource to find the mush if you're fairly or entirely certain you haven't been spored yet.
On november 16, 2013
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

She can't see invisible or private actions like taking a shower, getting hurt, failing to repair something or getting a new skill. She can only see furtive or secret actions, but sometimes they' happened so long ago that only Eleesha with the Tracker skill can see them.

It's usually very frustrating since she mainly notices uninteresting actions like eating, but the skill is still useful as a protection (an experienced mush will never spike if Eleesha is in the room) or as a bait.

[7899762]

A236 Janice's main role is to keep morale up. The shrink skill restores morale to anyone that is lying down in the same room as you when a cycle ends, so you should try to be in one the dorms at the end of every cycle. You can use comfort on anyone with very low morale.

[6826491]

A236a: Janice's Shrink skill also has the ability to cure mental illnesses, such as the Chronic Vertigo that Eleesha always starts with. To cure these, she must be standing, while her patient is in a bed in the same room. It may take several cycles to cure these illnesses, but her patients will also regain morale every cycle.

[7859998]

Q240: If you get left behind on expeditions do you instantly lose or can your team come back for you?
On november 17, 2013
[6826491]
WandererQ240: If you get left behind on expeditions do you instantly lose or can your team come back for you?

A240: You might not die immediately, but for every cycle you stay alone on the planet, you will lose one morale. Randomly dying each cycle is also possible, even with high morale; I had that happen to a lost crewmate once. If your crew quickly sends another expo after you, they might find you. There is even a chance that they might find you again during the same expo in which you got lost. It's also possible that someone else may get lost during the rescue expo...requiring another rescue expo, in some terribly unlucky instances...

It's also possible for someone in a patrol ship to conduct rescue operations, but one person will only search two sectors, and it's not remotely efficient, AP-wise. Up to 8 AP can be burned this way: 2 to take off, 4 to land, and 2 to dock. That said, if the Icarus was lost, it's the only way to conduct further expos...
On november 17, 2013
[7897397]

Q241: What ways are there to regain morale? I know about petting Schrödinger and Jin-su's speeches, but what else is there?
On november 17, 2013
[6826491]
XenocyanQ241: What ways are there to regain morale? I know about petting Schrödinger and Jin-su's speeches, but what else is there?

A241: Someone with the Shrink skill, usually Janice (as it's her first level skill) can be in the room while you are in a bed, and you'll gain one morale per cycle. This is why she usually stands in a dorm and the other people rotate through using the beds over the course of the voyage. Aside from the ones you mentioned, certain fruits, including bananas restore morale; alien fruit properties are randomized in each voyage, though. Pills might also restore morale, while others may subtract it. Flirting/Doing the Thing will give +2 morale to both partners, and that can be done once per day.

@ Q271: this question was already answered (i know it because i asked the same question ) you probaby need a surgery in the Medlab... with meditkit a healing of your arms will probably not work.
On november 19, 2013
[6826491]

A260: For bold text, it's the same as in the forum: add 2x * to each end of what you want to put in bold. For red italics, add 2x / to each end of what you want in italics. You can also mix them up.

A271: Negative, you require surgery, though the medkit will be useful for your HP. Go to the Medlab, lie down on the bed, and if Finola's alive, she can conduct surgery on you for 3 AP. If she's unable to heal you, then while you're lying down in the Medlab, click on the Surgery Pod, and you can attempt surgery on yourself for 4 AP (possibly more, depending on the kind of wounds you have).

A273: Turning it off allows for perishable food (fruits, coffee, cooked rations) to avoid being automatically destroyed at the end of each day. There exists the possibility that any of these may begin to spoil on the second day, and on subsequent days, there may be a chance of food poisoning. A Chef can determine its condition, including the percentage chance for food poisoning or any other effects.

On november 19, 2013
[6826491]
FragileQ275: What are the methods to cure physiological diseases? My condition looks fatal

A275: There are physical illnesses, like food poisoning or black bite, and there are wounds, like broken arms or torn tongue. The former only need the medkit or to be healed in the Medlab. Pills may also be effective on certain illnesses. The wounds are a more complicated matter...they require surgery. I detailed surgery in my answer for Q271 on this page.

Aivaras

Q274 How hunger works? Satisfaction from food?

Lets say person joins ship at Day 1 Cycle 1 and goes idle, at what time he would start starving?
How often can one eat standard ration?


A 274 : Someone starts to starve after 24 cycles with 0 of satisfaction.
As an human you get the " full " statut when you're at 3 or more of satisfaction.
To eat again your satisfaction as to be at 2 or under.
An human will lose one of satisfaction per cycle, two if he has " Tape Worn " as disease.

A ration gives you 4 of satisfaction so you'll have to wait 2 cycles to eat again if you're satisfaction was at 0 when you eat the first one.
If you eat another ration as soon as possible ( when you're satisfaction is at 2, so two cycles after you ate the first ration ), you're satisfaction will be at 6. So you'll to wait 4 cycles to eat again if you ate two rations " in a row ".

Hope I was clear enough.

AivarasSleep in same room Janice is. You must be in bed, she in room (doesn't matter in bed or not) also she must have shrink skill (most good Janice do - its lvl1 skill). It might take few cycles to get rid of it

A 275a : I think he meant physiological diseases and not mental illness, so Fragile, either you've a fruit/pill to cure your disease, either you can try to heal yourself ( or someone else can try ) with the medkit / medlab.

On november 20, 2013
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

A 283
It's an analysis that Finola is supposed to have conducted before the departure of the Daedalus. "Sample insufficient" means that the person is either Mush or human. It can also give negative results, meaning that the person was not an alpha Mush.

It's not like Eleesha's list, on which there's always at least one Mush.
On november 20, 2013
[6826491]

A283: The list on its own is mostly useless. It can be compared against Eleesha's list, and you might give any people that appear on both lists a bit more scrutiny. It sometimes lists people who are already dead, as well.
